roles: Bachelor's degree in International Relations graduate
supporting_quotes: Patricia Espinosa Cantellano graduated with a bachelor's degree in International Relations from El Colegio de México

organizations: Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies
supporting_quotes: earned a diploma in International Law at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Switzerland
Espinosa Cantellano joined the Foreign Service on September 16, 1981.

organizations: Permanent Mission of Mexico to UN, Geneva
supporting_quotes: Ambassador Cantellano has served as responsible for economic affairs, Permanent Mission of Mexico to UN, Geneva (1982-88)

roles: Head of Cabinet to Undersecretary of Foreign Affairs
supporting_quotes: Head, Cabinet to Undersecretary of Foreign Affairs (1989-91)
Director of International Organizations (1991-93)

organizations: Permanent Mission of Mexico to UN, New York
supporting_quotes: assigned to Permanent Mission of Mexico to UN, New York (1993-97)
President of the Third Committee, UN General Assembly (1996-97)

roles: General Director of Regional Organizations of the Americas
Coordinator for Rio Group, Iberoamerican Summit, Summit of Americas and Summit of Latin America and Caribbean with European Union
supporting_quotes: General Director of Regional Organizations of the Americas, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Coordinator for Rio Group, Iberoamerican Summit, Summit of Americas and Summit of Latin America and Caribbean with European Union (1997-99)
She was promoted to Ambassador within the Foreign Service in 2000
served at the Mexican Embassy in Germany from January 2001 to June 2002

roles: Representative to international organizations in Vienna
supporting_quotes: leaving the post to serve as Ambassador to Austria, concurrently with a number of international organizations based in Vienna, from 2002 to 2006.
On November 28, 2006, President-elect Felipe Calderón announced that she would serve as his Secretary of Foreign Affairs starting on December 1, 2006.
In office December 1, 2006 – December 1, 2012
Because of her outstanding career as a Mexican diplomat, she was appointed Ambassador Emeritus of Mexico in 2012.
Ambassador Emeritus of Mexico – highest honor given to five outstanding Mexican diplomats.
Awarded the German Sustainability Prize in 2012
From 2012 to 2016, she was again Ambassador of Mexico to Germany.
Ambassador of Mexico to Germany In office 6 September 2013 – 18 July 2016

organizations: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
supporting_quotes: In May 2016, Espinosa was selected by United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to be the Executive Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Executive Secretary of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change In office 18 July 2016 – 15 July 2022
Awarded the Sustainability Prize in 2019 by the Saxon Hans-Carl von Carlowitz Society.

organizations: Governments of Germany, Argentina, Austria, Chile, Colombia, Denmark, El Salvador, Guatemala, Netherlands, Paraguay and Peru
supporting_quotes: Decorated by the governments of Germany, Argentina, Austria, Chile, Colombia, Denmark, El Salvador, Guatemala, Netherlands, Paraguay and Peru.

roles: Member of the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the 2030 Agenda
supporting_quotes: Member of the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the 2030 Agenda.
Commissioner at the Global Commission of Adaptation
High-Level Consultative Group for the InsuResilience Global Partnership
Founder of the Berlin-Bonn chapter of the International Gender Champions
Member of the Advisory Board of the Mary Robinson Foundation – Climate Justice
Member of the OECD High-Level Advisory Group

organizations: The Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy
supporting_quotes: Member of The Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy Board
International Gender Champions (IGC), Member
